bill.title: Department of Business and Professional Regulation Licensing
bill.description: Requires DBPR to certify for licensure qualified individuals who practice mold assessment or mold remediation; revises requirements for issuance of asbestos consultant's license; requires DBPR to certify for licensure by endorsement certain asbestos consultants & asbestos contractors; requires asbestos consultants & asbestos contractors to complete certain courses; requires licensees & licensed agents to provide Division of Hotels & Restaurants with e-mail addresses at which they can be contacted; provides for expiration of public lodging establishment & public food service establishment licenses; requires division to provide forms for license renewals & license applications; revises public lodging establishment & public food service establishment license fees to include option for 2-year renewals; removes requirement limiting types of boxing exhibitions which require specified maximum difference in participant weights.

history.action: Referred to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee
Referred to State Administration & Technology Appropriations Subcommittee
Now in Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee
